decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The flats hereby approved shall not be first occupied until full details of a minimum of 92 secure and weather-protected residents' bicycle parking spaces have been submitted to, and agreed in writing by, the local planning authority. The revised details shall include the following: 

a)	Locations, type of stands, dimensions of stores, and identification of which use (office/residential) the storage is for. 
b)	Commercial and residential storage must be separate and must include 5% accessible stands (tubular) and must include both long stay and short stay spaces. 
c)	Storage should be designed in accordance with London Cycle Design Standards guidance

The on-site transport infrastructure so provided shall thereafter be retained and made available for the use of future occupiers of the development, prior to the first occupation of the development.

REASON: To ensure that adequate cycle parking provision is made for more sustainable transport modes on the site, in accordance with paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), Policy T6.1 of the Draft London Plan (2019) and Policy DM 43 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 2 - The flats hereby approved shall not be first occupied until a Car Parking Design and Management Plan has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. This must include:
a)	A detailed plan with a key setting out different uses;  
b)	Active and passive electric vehicle charge points;
c)	A plan demonstrating how parking will be managed, spaces are to be allocated, how this will be enforced; how additional disabled bays will be provided in future if demand increases and also how passive EV spaces can become active if demand increases; and
d)	Re-location of the 4 motorcycle parking spaces to avoid conflicts with other development. 

The on-site transport infrastructure and management plan referred to under (a), (b), (c) and (d) above shall thereafter be retained and made available for the use of future occupiers (and their visitors) of the development prior to the first occupation of the development.

REASON: To ensure that the provision of car parking (including car parking for disabled persons) complies with London Plan standards, and to ensure that adequate parking provision is made for more sustainable transport modes on the site, in accordance with paragraph 108 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policies 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), Policy T4 of the Draft London Plan, and Policy DM43 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).

Condition : 3 - No building or use hereby permitted shall be occupied or the use commenced until a revised Travel Plan comprising immediate, continuing and long-term measures to promote and encourage alternatives to single-occupancy car use, in compliance with Transport for London guidance has been submitted to, and been approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. The approved Travel Plan shall then be implemented, monitored and reviewed in accordance with the agreed Travel Plan Targets to the satisfaction of the council for the duration of the Travel Plan monitoring period, including any extended period of monitoring arising from the Travel Plan targets not being met at the end of the initial 5-year monitoring period.

REASON:  In order to deliver sustainable transport objectives including a reduction in single occupancy car journeys and the increased use of public transport, walking & cycling, in accordance with Policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016), Policy T4 of the Draft London Plan, and Policy DM43 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: CHANGE OF USE OF  OFFICES (CLASS B1A) TO 54 SELF-CONTAINED FLATS(CLASS C3) (PRIOR APPROVAL OF TRANSPORT & HIGHWAYS IMPACTS OF THE DEVELOPMENT, CONTAMINATION AND FLOODING RISKS ON THE SITE AND IMPACTS OF NOISE FROM COMMERCIAL PREMISES ON THE INTENDED OCCUPIERS OF THE DEVELOPMENT)
